snippet: A quarter of the artworks left to the museum by one benefactor have turned out to be fakes, misattributions or of poor quality, but the museum cannot easily get rid of them.
abstract: Brooklyn Museum is unable to sell or give away large cache of artwork donated from estate of Col Michael Friedsam in 1932, many pieces of which have proven to be fake or of poor quality; deaccession is blocked by clauses in Friedsam's will, but museum is seeking to circumvent legal hurdles in order to avoid paying hefty storage bill for works it no longer wants.
lead_paragraph: A quarter of the artworks left to the museum by one benefactor have turned out to be fakes, misattributions or of poor quality, but the museum cannot easily get rid of them.

headline.seo: Brooklyn Museum’s Problem With Some Gifts
headline.main: Brooklyn Museum Finds Some Problematic Gifts Can’t Be Returned
